desc: Keith Haring Subway Drawings Keith Haring created his iconic subway drawings in the 1980s in New York City, adorning blank advertising spaces with vibrant and dynamic figures. Haring’s art conveys messages of unity and social activism. These impromptu masterpieces became symbols in street art and continue to inspire artists today. Keith Haring A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,” with abstract marks and patterning. © Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
name: COACH JACKET (GRAPHIC)
washing_info: Hand wash cold, Do not dry clean, Do not tumble dry.

desc: UNIQLO and Marimekko are pleased to announce the new limited-edition collection just in time for a joyful summer sun. The new collection offers a wide array of breezy, comfortable dress, cut and sewn and skirt made in cotton and linen, along with hats, shoes, and bags for easy coordination. This collection features Marimekko’s world-renowned prints: Melooni (melon), Ruukku (pot) by Maija Isola, Lirinä (sound of gurgling water), Asema (station) by Pentti Rinta, along with Demeter by Katsuji Wakisaka and Galleria (gallery) by Vuokko Eskolin-Nurmesniemi. These vibrant and colorful patterns, full of the feeling of summer fun, are available for women, kids, and babies. Airy linen blend fabric. *#69 NAVY come with an underskirt. Comfortable elastic waist. Flared cut showcases the print design. With side pockets. *Please note that pattern placement may differ from the photo. Your understanding is appreciated.

desc: UNIQLO and Marimekko are pleased to announce the new limited-edition collection just in time for a joyful summer sun. The new collection offers a wide array of breezy, comfortable dress, cut and sewn and skirt made in cotton and linen, along with hats, shoes, and bags for easy coordination. This collection features Marimekko’s world-renowned prints: Melooni (melon), Ruukku (pot) by Maija Isola, Lirinä (sound of gurgling water), Asema (station) by Pentti Rinta, along with Demeter by Katsuji Wakisaka and Galleria (gallery) by Vuokko Eskolin-Nurmesniemi. These vibrant and colorful patterns, full of the feeling of summer fun, are available for women, kids, and babies. With UV Protection technology. Hand-washable. Size adjuster inside the sweatband. Versatile bucket hat design. Combines Marimekko’s signature bold print with a practical design. Distinctive print adds an accent to casual styles. desc: UNIQLO and Marimekko are pleased to announce the new limited-edition collection just in time for a joyful summer sun. The new collection offers a wide array of breezy, comfortable dress, cut and sewn and skirt made in cotton and linen, along with hats, shoes, and bags for easy coordination. This collection features Marimekko’s world-renowned prints: Melooni (melon), Ruukku (pot) by Maija Isola, Lirinä (sound of gurgling water), Asema (station) by Pentti Rinta, along with Demeter by Katsuji Wakisaka and Galleria (gallery) by Vuokko Eskolin-Nurmesniemi. These vibrant and colorful patterns, full of the feeling of summer fun, are available for women, kids, and babies. 100% cotton goes with any style. Shaped to fit the body for active use. Conveniently sized to hold a smartphone or long wallet. Added piping helps the bag keep its shape. Handy inner pocket for your keys or smartphone. Gender neutral design. Combines Marimekko’s signature bold print with a practical design. *Please note that pattern placement may differ from the photo. Your understanding is appreciated.

desc: 1980 Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back was released in 1980. It's the fifth film of the Skywalker Saga Films, second of the Original Trilogy. This T-shirt features the poster of the movie that was released as a teaser at the time. The front of the T-shirt features the poster that was first released in the U.S. and a design depicting the relationship between Yoda and Luke. The back side is a T-shirt design based on the poster design adopted in the UK in 1980. It is a piece that retains the atmosphere of the time of the film's release. Star Wars: Remastered by Kosuke Kawamura Star Wars is a brand cherished worldwide. Artist Kosuke Kawamura has reimagined the iconic poster graphics that have emerged over its long history. Enjoy the fusion of a galactic worldview and the artistic collage concept, with the aim of creating vintage T-shirts for the next generation. Kosuke Kawamura Kawamura was born in Hiroshima in 1979. His work as a collage artist has led to a variety of creative projects, from solo exhibitions around the world to corporate collaborations. He became the Creative Director of UT in 2022. © & ™ Lucasfilm Ltd.
name: STAR WARS SHORT SLEEVE UT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: The front has an embroidered logo of Kaiju No. 8, and the back has the letters ”JAKDF,” which stands for ”Japan Anti Kaiju Defense Force,” an organization specializing in defeating monsters in Japan, a monster superpower. The back print features the members of the JAKDF’s third Unit, to which the main character Kafka Hibino belongs. Kaiju No.8 The original work is a manga series by Naoya Matsumoto, currently serialized in ”Shonen Jump+” (Shueisha). The highly anticipated anime adaptation will begin airing in 2024. The story is set in a world where monsters threaten people's daily lives. The T-shirt collection depicts the ”Japan Anti-Kaiju Defense Force” defeating monsters, Kafka Hibino also known as Kaiju No. 8, and his friends from the dynamic storyline of the film. © JAKDF 3rd Division © Naoya Matsumoto/SHUEISHA
name: KAIJU NO.8 SHORT SLEEVE UT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: Colors for a Large Wall 1951 For this collection, we have selected Post-Impressionism and Abstract artworks to inspire our designs. This design is based on the artwork ”Colors for a Large Wall” (1951) by Ellsworth Kelly, and is remarkable because no aspect of the painting's appearance has been determined by the artist’s personal choices. To convey the work's size (240 x 240 cm), the design is printed prominently on the back, and the white body color implies a white gallery wall. MoMA Art Icons This latest collection was created by The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) and UNIQLO through our partnership. We selected some of our favorite works from MoMA's extensive collection and reimagined them for everyday wear. Ellsworth Kelly © Ellsworth Kelly Foundation The Museum of Modern Art, MoMA, and related elements are trademarks of The Museum of Modern Art.
name: MOMA ART ICONS UT SHORT SLEEVE T-SHIRT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: Jacob's Ladder 1957 For this collection, we have selected Post-Impressionism and Abstract artworks to inspire our designs. The design for this piece is based on the work ”Jacob's Ladder” (1957) by Helen Frankenthaler, one of the most famous painters of the 20th century. She utilized the soak-stain painting technique, which is used in this work that measures 287.9 x 177.5 cm, making it a large and powerful work and a fan favorite at MoMA. To convey the work's size, the design is printed prominently on the back, and the white body color implies a white gallery wall. MoMA Art Icons This latest collection was created by The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) and UNIQLO through our partnership. We selected some of our favorite works from MoMA's extensive collection and reimagined them for everyday wear. Helen Frankenthaler © 2023 Helen Frankenthaler Foundation, Inc. / Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York The Museum of Modern Art, MoMA, and related elements are trademarks of The Museum of Modern Art.
name: MOMA ART ICONS UT SHORT SLEEVE T-SHIRT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: Small Worlds VII (Kleine Welten VII) from Small Worlds (Kleine Welten) 1922 For this collection, we have selected Post-Impressionism and Abstract artworks to inspire our designs. The design is based on the work ”Small Worlds VII (Kleine Welten VII) from Small Worlds (Kleine Welten) ”(1922) by Vasily Kandinsky, a pioneer of abstract art. The body color is black, the same background color as the artwork, to showcase the various techniques used in the work, such as etching, woodcutting, and lithography, as well as the composition of the ”small world” that gives the work its name. MoMA Art Icons This latest collection was created by The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) and UNIQLO through our partnership. We selected some of our favorite works from MoMA's extensive collection and reimagined them for everyday wear. Vasily Kandinsky The Museum of Modern Art, MoMA, and related elements are trademarks of The Museum of Modern Art.
name: MOMA ART ICONS UT SHORT SLEEVE T-SHIRT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: The Starry Night Saint Rémy, June 1889 For this collection, we have selected Post-Impressionism and Abstract artworks to inspire our designs. The T-shirt is based on one of the most iconic works in MoMA's collection, Vincent van Gogh's ”The Starry Night” (1889). To match the image of the night sky, the T-shirt body color is black with a bold rearrangement of the MoMA logo. MoMA Art Icons This latest collection was created by The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) and UNIQLO through our partnership. We selected some of our favorite works from MoMA's extensive collection and reimagined them for everyday wear. Vincent van Gogh The Museum of Modern Art, MoMA, and related elements are trademarks of The Museum of Modern Art.
name: MOMA ART ICONS UT SHORT SLEEVE T-SHIRT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: A Karasuno High School themed design. The school icon is featured on the front pocket. And on the back is an original eye-catching design which combines the Karasuno High School banner “Fly!‘’ and the moment just before Hinata’s spike. HAIKYU!! HAIKYU‼ makes its long awaited comeback with a new movie. This new movie features one of the series’ most popular storylines-the game between Karasuno High School and Nekoma High School also known as “The Dumpster Battle”. These T-shirts feature the passionate youth of high schoolers dedicated to volleyball. This collection demonstrates the enthusiasm, courage, and excitement of youth. ©HF/S,HP
name: HAIKYU!! UT (SHORT SLEEVE GRAPHIC T-SHIRT)

desc: UT ARCHIVE Andy Warhol / Keith Haring / Jean-Michel Basquiat “UT Archive” is a project that revives carefully selected T-shirts which have been sold in the past. From the UT collection that has been on sale for about 20 years, popular patterns by Andy Warhol, Basquiat, and Keith Haring will be re-released. Andy Warhol As the preeminent American artist of the 20th Century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently. This product is produced under a license from The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc., a New York not-for-profit corporation which promotes the visual arts. Keith Haring A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,”with abstract marks and patterning. Jean-Michel Basquiat An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events. ©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc. © Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York. © Estate of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
name: UT ARCHIVE ART UT (SHORT SLEEVE GRAPHIC T-SHIRT)
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: Still Life with Apples 1895-98 For this collection, we have selected Post-Impressionism and Abstract artworks to inspire our designs. The T-shirt design is based on the work ”Still Life with Apples” (1895-98) by Paul Cézanne, known as the father of modern painting. The body color of the T-shirt is white to imply white gallery walls, and the MoMA logo is boldly rearranged. MoMA Art Icons This latest collection was created by The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) and UNIQLO through our partnership. We selected some of our favorite works from MoMA's extensive collection and reimagined them for everyday wear. Paul Cezanne The Museum of Modern Art, MoMA, and related elements are trademarks of The Museum of Modern Art.

desc: 1999 Star Wars: The Phantom Menace Star Wars: The Phantom Menace was released in 1999. The young Anakin is born a slave, discovered by a Jedi master, and he grew up to be a powerful Jedi, but a deep fear of loss caused him to fall to the dark side. This design was adopted from the poster for the film, which depicts Anakin's growth and the light and darkness of his life. Star Wars: Remastered by Kosuke Kawamura Star Wars is a brand cherished worldwide. Artist Kosuke Kawamura has reimagined the iconic poster graphics that have emerged over its long history. Enjoy the fusion of a galactic worldview and the artistic collage concept, with the aim of creating vintage T-shirts for the next generation. Kosuke Kawamura Kawamura was born in Hiroshima in 1979. His work as a collage artist has led to a variety of creative projects, from solo exhibitions around the world to corporate collaborations. He became the Creative Director of UT in 2022. © & ™ Lucasfilm Ltd.
name: STAR WARS SHORT SLEEVE UT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: This limited edition artwork was created for UT by the animation studio Production I.G and depicts the scene where the main character Kafka transforms into Kaiju No. 8 for the first time. The numbers below the graphic represent the ”fortitude” of the monster's strength and the monster's identification number. Kaiju No.8 The original work is a manga series by Naoya Matsumoto, currently serialized in ”Shonen Jump+” (Shueisha). The highly anticipated anime adaptation will begin airing in 2024. The story is set in a world where monsters threaten people's daily lives. The T-shirt collection depicts the ”Japan Anti-Kaiju Defense Force” defeating monsters, Kafka Hibino also known as Kaiju No. 8, and his friends from the dynamic storyline of the film. © JAKDF 3rd Division © Naoya Matsumoto/SHUEISHA
name: KAIJU NO.8 SHORT SLEEVE UT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: The key visual of ”Haikyu the Movie!! FINAL Series” is featured on this T-shirt. This is a UNIQLO exclusive pattern that combines the eye-catching visual of the main character, Shoyo Hinata, with the members of the Karasuno High School volleyball team along with the words ”What will you become tomorrow?” HAIKYU!! HAIKYU‼ makes its long awaited comeback with a new movie. This new movie features one of the series’ most popular storylines-the game between Karasuno High School and Nekoma High School also known as “The Dumpster Battle”. These T-shirts feature the passionate youth of high schoolers dedicated to volleyball. This collection demonstrates the enthusiasm, courage, and excitement of youth. ©HF/S,HP
name: HAIKYU!! UT (SHORT SLEEVE GRAPHIC T-SHIRT)

desc: UT ARCHIVE Andy Warhol / Keith Haring / Jean-Michel Basquiat “UT Archive” is a project that revives carefully selected T-shirts which have been sold in the past. From the UT collection that has been on sale for about 20 years, popular patterns by Andy Warhol, Basquiat, and Keith Haring will be re-released. Andy Warhol As the preeminent American artist of the 20th Century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently. This product is produced under a license from The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc., a New York not-for-profit corporation which promotes the visual arts. Keith Haring A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,”with abstract marks and patterning. Jean-Michel Basquiat An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events. ©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc. © Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York. © Estate of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
name: UT ARCHIVE UT (SHORT SLEEVE GRAPHIC T-SHIRT) (JEAN-MICHEL BASQUIAT)

desc: PEACE FOR ALL “It’s time for action, in the name of world peace.” Major figures who share this vision with UNIQLO have volunteered to design T-shirts expressing their peaceful wishes. All proceeds will be donated to international organizations supporting those affected by violence, discrimination, armed conflict, and poverty. The Peace for All project is powered by each and every one of you who wears these T-shirts. Our wish is for a world in which all people can feel the peace of a future where everyone can live safely together. UNIQLO will continue to broaden this initiative, working with people all around the world. *UNIQLO parent company Fast Retailing Co., Ltd. will donate an amount equivalent to all profits (no less than 20% of the selling price) equally among UNHCR, Save the Children Japan, and Plan International Inc. This sales promotion is conducted by Fast Retailing, a parent company of UNIQLO Japan. Takeshi Yoro Anatomist / Born in 1937 in Kamakura, Kanagawa Prefecture. Anatomist. Graduated from the University of Tokyo Faculty of Medicine. Professor Emeritus at the University of Tokyo. Author of the 2003 best-seller The Wall of Fools, he is the recipient of awards from the Shingo Ryukogo Taisho buzzword contest and the Mainichi Publishing Culture Awards. The books in his “Wall” series have sold millions of copies. A known lover of cats and insects, he conceived of the idea for MushizuKa, an innovative memorial to insect life at Kamakura’s Kencho-ji Temple. Focusing on peace makes perfect sense. With so much of the world looking for peace, how can it be any other way? This T-shirt is a tribute to my late cat, Maru. When a stray cat took its food, Maru didn’t get upset until a minute after the other cat was gone. A cat who could not fight. Though perhaps that’s for the best. The time has come to give peace our undivided attention. ©SHINCHOSHA
name: TAKESHI YORO SHORT SLEEVE T-SHIRT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: PEACE FOR ALL “It’s time for action, in the name of world peace.” Major figures who share this vision with UNIQLO have volunteered to design T-shirts expressing their peaceful wishes. All proceeds will be donated to international organizations supporting those affected by violence, discrimination, armed conflict, and poverty. The Peace for All project is powered by each and every one of you who wears these T-shirts. Our wish is for a world in which all people can feel the peace of a future where everyone can live safely together. UNIQLO will continue to broaden this initiative, working with people all around the world. *UNIQLO parent company Fast Retailing Co., Ltd. will donate an amount equivalent to all profits (no less than 20% of the selling price) equally among UNHCR, Save the Children Japan, and Plan International Inc. This sales promotion is conducted by Fast Retailing, a parent company of UNIQLO Japan. Khaled Hosseini Novelist / Khaled Hosseini was born in Kabul, Afghanistan, in 1965. In 1980, after the Soviet invasion of his birthplace, Khaled and his family were granted political asylum in the U.S. Khaled studied medicine and practiced as a physician in California until 2004, after which he dedicated himself to writing. He is the author of The Kite Runner, A Thousand Splendid Suns, and other books. He has served as a Goodwill Ambassador for UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, since 2006. In 2008, he launched The Khaled Hosseini Foundation, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit, which provides humanitarian assistance to the people of Afghanistan. He lives in CA. I grew up flying kites in pre-war Afghanistan and always associate them in my mind with peace. My design is a reminder that we are at our best when we approach one another with dignity and resolve our differences though mutual understanding and respect.
name: K. HOSSEINI SHORT SLEEVE T-SHIRT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: PEACE FOR ALL “It’s time for action, in the name of world peace.” Major figures who share this vision with UNIQLO have volunteered to design T-shirts expressing their peaceful wishes. The Peace for All project is powered by each and every one of you who wears these T-shirts. Our wish is for a world in which all people can feel the peace of a future where everyone can live safely together. UNIQLO will continue to broaden this initiative, working with people all around the world. *UNIQLO parent company Fast Retailing Co., Ltd. will donate an amount equivalent to all profits (no less than 20% of the selling price) equally among UNHCR, Save the Children Japan, and Plan International Inc. This sales promotion is conducted by Fast Retailing, a parent company of UNIQLO Japan. Jason Polan Artist / Jason Polan, originally from Michigan, lived in New York following college. His work is exhibited all over the world. He was the founding member of Taco Bell Drawing Club. Polan did projects with The New York Times, The Ford Foundation, The New Yorker and more. Polan continued to draw every person in New York until his death from cancer at age 37. Stronger Together was drawn on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan on January 21, 2017. It is part of Every Person in New York, a project that Jason Polan began on September 4, 2008, and which was later compiled into two books: Every Person in New York and Every Person in New York, Volume 2. He drew people he saw every day, and each night he scanned the drawings, uploading them to his blog. Jason knew he could never finish this project and was totally okay with that. He liked the idea that it would be a project he could work on forever. ©Jason Polan
name: JASON POLAN SHORT SLEEVE T-SHIRT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

This sales promotion is conducted by Fast Retailing, a parent company of UNIQLO Japan. MOOMIN Novels, Picture Books & Comics / Tove Jansson created the Moomins in 1945. These lovable charcters have gone on to charm millions of fans with their wit and wisdom. Tove Jansson's work is a reflection of an entire life philosophy. Moominvalley is a valley of peace. Tove Jansson, the creator of the Moomins, was an ardent pacifist, and in her Moomin stories she created a utopia centered around the welcoming and tolerant Moomin family. The stories feature a diverse set of characters, each valued for their unique qualities. Despite, or maybe because of their differences they all manage to peacefully coexist with each other. ©Moomin Characters™
name: MOOMIN SHORT SLEEVE UT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

Herzog & de Meuron Architects / Herzog & de Meuron is an international architectural practice based in Basel, Switzerland. Established in 1978, the practice is led by the two founders together with the Partners and the CEO. Today, an international team of over 550 collaborators is engaged in a wide range of projects across Europe, the Americas and Asia. The main office in Basel works in tandem with studios in Berlin and Munich, Paris, London, Hong Kong, New York and San Francisco, and site offices in Copenhagen, Jerusalem and Hangzhou. We do not believe that a T-shirt can express much of a philosophical message. But it does eventually inspire some thoughts, make you imagine some dream or hear some song of a peaceful past. That is what we need so much these days.
name: HERZOG & DE MEURON UT (SHORT SLEEVE GRAPHIC T-SHIRT)

Since 1966, the Ultraman series has been a vehicle of courage, hope, and compassion, expressed through Ultraman’s love for Earth and a cast of unique Kaiju. This design features the text “PEACE FOR ALL” alongside Ultraman Cosmos, a hero balancing strength and kindness who fought for a world in which people and monsters are able to coexist in peace. ©TSUBURAYA PRODUCTIONS

This sales promotion is conducted by Fast Retailing, a parent company of UNIQLO Japan. Yu Nagaba Artist / Artist. Born in 1976 in Tokyo. Alongside work in advertising and publishing, Yu has collaborated with famous brands and companies in Japan and abroad. In 2019, he staged the solo exhibition Express More with Less, which showcased a transition from drawing to the medium of canvas. The following year, his show The Last Supper at Gallery SAI in Shibuya drew critical acclaim. Since then, his work has continued to garner attention at home and abroad, with solo exhibitions in Hong Kong and Taiwan and participation in the Chinese art fair “WEST BEND.” Distant Voices, Close Hearts Heartfelt bonds persist even when our loved ones happen to be far away. Sympathy and emotion connect us, transcending distance and borders. Physical distance is an afterthought, because our hearts are always linked.
name: YU NAGABA SHORT SLEEVE T-SHIRT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

Emmanuelle Moureaux Architect , Artist, Designer / French architect, artist and designer living in Tokyo since 1996. Inspired by the layers and colors of Tokyo that built a complex depth and density on the street, and the traditional spatial elements like sliding screens, she has created the concept of ”shikiri”, which literally means ”dividing (creating) space with colors”. Using colors as her signature, her works extend to a number of projects, including architectural design for Sugamo Shinkin Bank, art installations for UNIQLO and ISSEY MIYAKE, ”100 colors” art installation series, and ”Forest of Numbers” at The National Art Center, Tokyo. Professor at Tohoku University of Art and Design. ”When I Saw the Earth for the First Time” I imagined a picture book with a title like this. The colorful sphere represents the earth, the yellow sphere represents the sun, and the child holding the balloon is you, the main character. The diversity of living creatures that exist on this earth creates and drives the beauty of the earth. I expressed that through the universality and infinity of color. I hope that colors will move people’s hearts.
name: E. MOUREAUX SHORT SLEEVE T-SHIRT

Jean-Michel Basquiat Artist/An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events. Christopher Makos Photogorapher/Christopher Makos is known internationally for his explosive and innovative photography. Makos became a prominent figure in the New York downtown art scene where he befriended and created raw,indelible portraits of artists and creatives such as Jean-Michel Basquiat. His photographs have been exhibited in more than 100 museums and galleries. ”Jean-Michel Basquiat and Christopher Makos positioned Basquiat with the globe, adjusted just so, to emphasize that Basquiat’s inspiration and influence were global.”

desc: This t-shirt was designed by Gosho Aoyama, the author of the original manga. It features heart-warming illustrations of Heiji Hattori, a high school detective from western Japan, and his childhood friend Kazuha Toyama. Hidden in the front pocket is the charm of their memories, related to the episode "The Whereabouts of the Embarrassing Charm". Introduction of Detective Conan (Case Closed) After solving a case, high school detective Shinichi Kudo witnessed men dressed all in black engaging in suspicious activity. In an attempt to silence him, they force-fed him a mysterious drug that caused his body to shrink to that of a first grader. Gosho Aoyama's mystery manga "Detective Conan (Case Closed)", which began serialization in "Weekly Shonen Sunday" in 1994, is now a very popular manga with more than 100 volumes. This original design, featuring fan-favorite scenes and art, are available only at UNIQLO. ©Gosho Aoyama/Shogakukan
name: DETECTIVE CONAN UT (SHORT SLEEVE GRAPHIC T-SHIRT)
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

Introduction of Detective Conan (Case Closed) After solving a case, high school detective Shinichi Kudo witnessed men dressed all in black engaging in suspicious activity. In an attempt to silence him, they force-fed him a mysterious drug that caused his body to shrink to that of a first grader. Gosho Aoyama’s mystery manga ”Detective Conan (Case Closed)”, which began serialization in ”Weekly Shonen Sunday” in 1994, is now a very popular manga with more than 100 volumes. This original design, featuring fan-favorite scenes and art, are available only at UNIQLO. ©Gosho Aoyama/Shogakukan
name: DETECTIVE CONAN UT (SHORT SLEEVE GRAPHIC T-SHIRT)
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: Curated by Tate UNIQLO is Made for All. Tate’s Art is for All. Tate and UNIQLO have been in partnership since 2016, championing a shared belief that Art and Play are for everyone. For this UT collection, we have chosen artworks from Tate collection artists that reflect the spirit of Play. Alexander Calder Alexander Calder (August 22, 1898– November 11, 1976) is an American artist who profoundly changed the course of modern art. He is renowned for the invention of the mobile, whose suspended, abstract elements move and balance in changing harmony. He also created stabiles, or stationary objects, and his monumental outdoor sculptures can be found in public spaces in cities worldwide. © 2024 Calder Foundation, New York / DACS London, © Tate 2024

desc: Keith Haring Subway Drawings Keith Haring created his iconic subway drawings in the 1980s in New York City, adorning blank advertising spaces with vibrant and dynamic figures. Haring's art conveys messages of unity and social activism. These impromptu masterpieces became symbols in street art and continue to inspire artists today. Keith Haring A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,” with abstract marks and patterning. © Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York. Photo by Tseng Kwong Chi © Muna Tseng Dance Projects, Inc. Art by Keith Haring © Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
name: KEITH HARING UT (SHORT SLEEVE GRAPHIC T-SHIRT)
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

TV animation ONE PIECE 25th In 2024, the 25th anniversary of the TV anime ONE PIECE, the adventures of the main character, Monkey D. Luffy, were made into T-shirts. This commemorative collection features designs from the "East Blue" to the latest "Egghead". ©Eiichiro Oda/Shueisha, Toei Animation
name: ONE PIECE 25TH SHORT SLEEVE UT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: Set sail !! This piece is themed around the "reunion" of the Straw Hat Crew after two years of training in the Fish Man Island. After the defeated by the Admiral Kizaru and Bartholomew Kuma in the Sabaody Archipelago, the crew reunites in the Sabaody Archipelago after two years of training. The design depicts the crew as they embark on a new journey. TV animation ONE PIECE 25th In 2024, the 25th anniversary of the TV anime ONE PIECE, the adventures of the main character, Monkey D. Luffy, were made into T-shirts. This commemorative collection features designs from the "East Blue" to the latest "Egghead". ©Eiichiro Oda/Shueisha, Toei Animation

desc: Thank you for loving me!! This piece from the Marineford focuses on the theme of Luffy’s “the loss" due to the death of his beloved older brother Ace. Luffy goes to Marineford , where the Navy has its headquarters, to save his brother Ace, who has been sentenced to public execution. There, Ace defends Luffy from an attack by the Admiral Akainu and is pierced through the stomach. Ace speaks of his gratitude to his friends who loved him and dies in Luffy's arms. This is a picture of Luffy's frustration at the loss of his beloved brother. TV animation ONE PIECE 25th In 2024, the 25th anniversary of the TV anime ONE PIECE, the adventures of the main character, Monkey D. Luffy, were made into T-shirts. This commemorative collection features designs from the "East Blue" to the latest "Egghead". ©Eiichiro Oda/Shueisha, Toei Animation
name: ONE PIECE 25TH SHORT SLEEVE UT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: All of my abilities have evolved to the next level... This is a piece featuring Captain Luffy’s “strength " from the Enies Lobby. Straw Hat Crew fights against CP9, an intelligence agency directly under the direct control of The World Government , in Enies Lobby to get Robin back. To be with his friends. The design depicts the scene of Luffy's new technique, "Gear Two," which expresses his self awareness as captain and his feelings for his friends. desc: Familiar faces from FINAL FANTASY XIV—a moogle, Alpha, and a fat cat—are embroidered on the breast of the shirt. The single-graphic design brings a cute twist to this pocket t-shirt. FINAL FANTASY Debuting in 1987, the FINAL FANTASY series has earned worldwide acclaim for its cutting-edge visuals, distinctive world-building, and captivating storytelling. This exclusive collection seamlessly melds the art of Yoshitaka Amano—renowned for helping bring to life the series' unique worldview—alongside the iconic pixel art from the first six titles. Also featured are designs from the series’ online RPG, FFXIV, as well as its latest mainline installment, FFXVI. © SQUARE ENIX LOGO & IMAGE ILLUSTRATION: © YOSHITAKA AMANO
name: FINAL FANTASY SHORT SLEEVE UT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: UT ARCHIVE Andy Warhol / Keith Haring / Jean-Michel Basquiat “UT Archive” is a project that revives carefully selected T-shirts which have been sold in the past. From the UT collection that has been on sale for about 20 years, popular patterns by Andy Warhol, Basquiat, and Keith Haring will be re-released. Andy Warhol As the preeminent American artist of the 20th Century, Andy Warhol challenged the world to see art differently. This product is produced under a license from The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc., a New York not-for-profit corporation which promotes the visual arts. Keith Haring A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,”with abstract marks and patterning. Jean-Michel Basquiat An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events. ©/®/™ The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc. © Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York. © Estate of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
name: NY POP ART UT (SHORT SLEEVE GRAPHIC T-SHIRT)
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: I'm gonna be king of the pirates!! This piece is based on the theme of "determination" to start a journey from the East Blue. One day, Monkey D. Luffy , a boy living in the Windmill Village in the East Blue, eats a Devil fruit and his body becomes like rubber. Promising to reunite with Shanks , the man who saved his life, Luffy sets out on a voyage alone to become the king of the pirates 10 years later. Luffy's determined line "I'm gonna be king of the pirates!!" and his figure on this T-shirt. desc: Our left arms will bear the sign of our fellowship! This piece from the Alabasta is based on the theme of the bond between "friends". The series depicts the encounter with Vivi and the bond between friends during the fierce battle in the Kingdom of Alabasta ruled by Crocodile, one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea. As a princess, she chooses to live with her beloved country, but when she meets him again, she wants him to call her his friend again. Luffy and his friends respond to Vivi ’s tearful question by holding up the mark of companionship on their left arms. This is a picture of the scene where they confirmed the marks of their comrades drawn on their arms before the decisive battle. TV animation ONE PIECE 25th In 2024, the 25th anniversary of the TV anime ONE PIECE, the adventures of the main character, Monkey D. Luffy, were made into T-shirts. This commemorative collection features designs from the "East Blue" to the latest "Egghead". ©Eiichiro Oda/Shueisha, Toei Animation
name: ONE PIECE 25TH SHORT SLEEVE UT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: PEACE FOR ALL “It’s time for action, in the name of world peace.” Major figures who share this vision with UNIQLO have volunteered to design T-shirts expressing their peaceful wishes. All proceeds will be donated to international organizations supporting those affected by violence, discrimination, armed conflict, and poverty. The Peace for All project is powered by each and every one of you who wears these T-shirts. Our wish is for a world in which all people can feel the peace of a future where everyone can live safely together. UNIQLO will continue to broaden this initiative, working with people all around the world. *UNIQLO parent company Fast Retailing Co., Ltd. will donate an amount equivalent to all profits (no less than 20% of the selling price) equally among UNHCR, Save the Children Japan, and Plan International Inc. This sales promotion is conducted by Fast Retailing, a parent company of UNIQLO Japan. Saul Leiter Photographer / Saul Leiter was a legendary photographer who spent most of his life in New York City. His work appeared in well-known fashion magazines in the 1950s and 1960s, but he stepped away from the front line in the 1980s. His photo collection Early Color was released in 2006, when he was 82 years old, and was a major hit as he rose to prominence as a pioneer of color photography. Retrospectives and publications featuring Saul Leiter continue to be presented around the world, and a documentary film was released in 2013. Saul Leiter passed away in 2013. Saul Leiter had a knack for capturing peaceful moments that hush the considerable noise of New York City. “It’s been decided that I have a penchant for quietness,” he once said with a chuckle. Whether Leiter is observing a gentle kiss in Times Square amid the hubbub of New Year’s Eve celebrations or finding a solitary young girl in a red coat making a snowball behind a downtown apartment building, the photographer communes with his surroundings to portray a uniquely tranquil vision of his beloved New York.
name: SAUL LEITER SHORT SLEEVE T-SHIRT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: PEACE FOR ALL “It’s time for action, in the name of world peace.” Major figures who share this vision with UNIQLO have volunteered to design T-shirts expressing their peaceful wishes. All proceeds will be donated to international organizations supporting those affected by violence, discrimination, armed conflict, and poverty. The Peace for All project is powered by each and every one of you who wears these T-shirts. Our wish is for a world in which all people can feel the peace of a future where everyone can live safely together. UNIQLO will continue to broaden this initiative, working with people all around the world. *UNIQLO parent company Fast Retailing Co., Ltd. will donate an amount equivalent to all profits (no less than 20% of the selling price) equally among UNHCR, Save the Children Japan, and Plan International Inc. This sales promotion is conducted by Fast Retailing, a parent company of UNIQLO Japan. Han Meilin Artist / Born in 1936, Han Meilin is a renowned contemporary Chinese artist and diligent trailblazer whose artworks span across painting, calligraphy, sculpture, ceramics to folk art. He has been bestowed prestigious titles around the world including UNESCO's "Artist for Peace" in 2015. One of his best-known artworks is "Fuwa", the iconic mascot of the 2008 Summer Olympic Games in Beijing. "I've created numerous animal drawings, driven by my deep love for nature and animals. The true calling of an artist lies in treating all forms of life with kindness. I see the world through a heart filled with love, dedicated to the pursuit of peace. The dove, holding an olive branch, stands as a powerful symbol of peace, and its impact reaches far beyond the canvas.Great love knows no bounds."
name: HAN MEILIN SHORT SLEEVE T-SHIRT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

Active in the fields of design, architecture, and contemporary art. The “Sakura Torch” for the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games, the glass bench exhibited at Musée d'Orsay in Paris called “Water Block,” and the glass teahouse “KOU-AN” are some of the signature pieces. Many of his works are chosen as part of permanent collections in world renowned museums. He has won many international awards. Light for Peace The reflection emits a light of hope. The light is a wish for peace.
name: TOKUJIN YOSHIOKA SHORT SLEEVE T-SHIRT

desc: UNIQLO and Marimekko are pleased to announce the new limited-edition collection just in time for a joyful summer sun. The new collection offers a wide array of breezy, comfortable dress, cut and sewn and skirt made in cotton and linen, along with hats, shoes, and bags for easy coordination. This collection features Marimekko’s world-renowned prints: Melooni (melon), Ruukku (pot) by Maija Isola, Lirinä (sound of gurgling water), Asema (station) by Pentti Rinta, along with Demeter by Katsuji Wakisaka and Galleria (gallery) by Vuokko Eskolin-Nurmesniemi. These vibrant and colorful patterns, full of the feeling of summer fun, are available for women, kids, and babies. Soft and comfortable linen blend fabric. Open collar design. Shirt tail hem. Short length. Relaxed, straight cut in the body. Combines Marimekko’s signature bold print with an easy-to-wear silhouette. *Please note that pattern placement may differ from the photo. Your understanding is appreciated.

washing_info: Machine wash cold, gentle cycle, Dry Clean, Do not tumble dry.

desc: A design featuring the most memorable song on the album, “BONA BONA.” The front features a print of the word TREASURE, the lyrics “Born to love ya,” and a graphic with a CD motif. The back hem features a print of TREASURE’s key visual graphic. Find Your TREASURE A collaboration between the hugely popular K-pop idol group TREASURE and UT has been realized. This collection is like a “best of” album, with each design featuring a representative song from the group. TREASURE A K-pop idol group that successfully debuted in 2020 through the audition program “YG Treasure Box.” The global group consists of 10 members, with seven members in charge of vocals and three members in charge of rap. They enjoy strong popularity not only in Korea but also in Japan and Southeast Asia, and they have plans to expand their activities to North America and Europe in the future. 🄫YG ENTERTAINMENT INC.
name: OVERSIZED FIND YOUR TREASURE UT (BONA BONA)
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.

desc: UNIQLO and Marimekko are pleased to announce the new limited-edition collection just in time for a joyful summer sun. The new collection offers a wide array of breezy, comfortable dress, cut and sewn and skirt made in cotton and linen, along with hats, shoes, and bags for easy coordination. This collection features Marimekko’s world-renowned prints: Melooni (melon), Ruukku (pot) by Maija Isola, Lirinä (sound of gurgling water), Asema (station) by Pentti Rinta, along with Demeter by Katsuji Wakisaka and Galleria (gallery) by Vuokko Eskolin-Nurmesniemi. These vibrant and colorful patterns, full of the feeling of summer fun, are available for women, kids, and babies. 100% cotton. Versatile A-line cut pairs well with skirts and pants. Combines Marimekko’s signature bold print with an easy-to-wear silhouette. Statement print design. Neck design is perfect for layering. *Please note that pattern placement may differ from the photo. Your understanding is appreciated.
name: GRAPHIC SLEEVELESS T-SHIRT
washing_info: Machine wash cold, Do not dry clean, Tumble dry low.
